[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_backup] [Quote Escaping] Can an attacker inject unescaped quotes into create_backup commands that break out of argument strings and inject additional shell commands? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_for_write] [Backtick Injection] Does create_for_write properly prevent backtick command substitution (`malicious`), which could execute arbitrary commands during file creation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.open_for_read] [Dollar Expansion] Can an attacker inject $(...) or ${...} expansion syntax into open_for_read commands to execute commands and substitute their output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.save_metadata_line] [Pipe Injection] Can save_metadata_line commands be exploited by injecting pipe characters that redirect command output or input to attacker-controlled processes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.list_metadata_files] [Redirection Injection] Can an attacker inject file redirection operators (>, >>, <) into list_metadata_files that overwrite critical system files or exfiltrate data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands] [Setuid Binary Abuse] Can attackers specify setuid/setgid binaries in command strings that execute with elevated privileges, escalating from backup operator to root? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: CommandAdapterConfig.env_vars] [LD_PRELOAD Attack] Can an attacker inject LD_PRELOAD environment variables through env_vars that load malicious shared libraries during command execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: CommandAdapterConfig.env_vars] [PATH Manipulation] Can attackers modify the PATH environment variable to execute malicious binaries instead of legitimate backup tools? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_backup] [Backup Handle Collision] Can an attacker predict or forge BackupHandle values returned by create_backup, allowing them to corrupt or hijack other validators' backup sessions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_for_write] [FileHandle Prediction] Are FileHandles returned by create_for_write sufficiently random, or can attackers predict them to write to files belonging to other backup operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.open_for_read] [Cache Poisoning] Can an attacker manipulate open_for_read to return cached corrupted data that validators use for state restoration, poisoning multiple validators simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [Timing Side Channel] Does load_from_file() execution time vary based on config content in ways that leak sensitive information about backup configuration or storage locations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands] [Command Timing] Can attackers infer sensitive validator state by measuring execution time of backup commands configured in Commands? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_backup] [Hanging Commands] Can an attacker specify backup commands that hang indefinitely, causing backup operations to timeout and preventing validators from creating backups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.list_metadata_files] [Output Flooding] Can list_metadata_files be exploited to produce unbounded output that exhausts memory or storage when parsed by the backup CLI? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [File Descriptor Exhaustion] Can repeated calls to load_from_file() without proper cleanup exhaust file descriptor limits, preventing backup operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.open_for_read] [Malicious Restoration] During disaster recovery, can an attacker substitute malicious backup data through compromised open_for_read commands, causing validators to restore attacker-controlled state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.list_metadata_files] [Metadata Manipulation] Can attackers manipulate metadata file listings to hide legitimate backups or present fake backups during restoration operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [ConfigMap Injection] In Kubernetes deployments, can attackers modify ConfigMaps containing backup configs to inject malicious commands that execute in validator pods? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: CommandAdapterConfig] [Secret Exposure] Does CommandAdapterConfig properly handle secrets (API keys, credentials), or can they leak through command strings or environment variables visible in process listings? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.create_for_write] [Network Exfiltration] Can attackers inject network commands (curl, wget, nc) into create_for_write that exfiltrate backup data to external servers during write operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands.open_for_read] [Remote Code Fetch] Can open_for_read commands be manipulated to fetch and execute code from remote servers, achieving remote code execution on validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: Commands] [Log Injection] Can attackers inject escape sequences or special characters into command strings that corrupt audit logs, hiding malicious backup operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [Audit Bypass] Is config loading properly audited, or can attackers load malicious configs without leaving forensic evidence in logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/storage/command_adapter/config.rs] [Struct: CommandAdapterConfig] [State Confusion] Can an attacker provide configs that create state confusion in backup operations, causing validators to mix data from different backup sessions? (High)
